description: water +‎ -proof. Compare West Frisian wetterproef (“waterproof”), Dutch waterproef (“waterproof”).

adjectives.description: waterproof (comparative more waterproof, superlative most waterproof)

entries.meaning: Resistant to the effects of water.
Made of or covered with material that doesn't allow water in.

examples: The only waterproof plan and the one increasingly adopted by leading trades is the consolidation of the interests of all parties in a scheme of amalgamation.

entries.meaning: A substance or preparation for rendering cloth, leather, etc., impervious to water.
Cloth made waterproof, or any article made of such cloth, or of other waterproof material, as rubber; especially, an outer garment made of such material.

verbs.description: waterproof (third-person singular simple present waterproofs, present participle waterproofing, simple past and past participle waterproofed)
